revised_title: The Synthesis and Properties of Dimethylamine
tldr: The author, A.W. Hofmann, discusses the synthesis and properties of dimethylamine, a type of alkylamine. He describes the reaction between iodide of methyl and ammonia, as well as the separation of dimethylamine from other ammonias produced in the reaction. Dimethylamine is a powerful alkaline liquid with a strong ammoniacal odor and is easily soluble in water.
